@description.name: @description
@description.body: Column width array for a whole set of columns

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
numColumns {Integer}
The number of columns being used.
@param.description: The number of columns being used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the array of column data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Set the width, minimum width and/or maximum width of a column at one
time.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
column {Integer}
The column number whose attributes are being set.
@param.description: The column number whose attributes are being set.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
An object with any or all of the three members, "width", "minWidth",
"maxWidth".  The property values are as described for {@link
#setWidth}, {@link #setMinWidth} and {@link #setMaxWidth}
respectively.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: column {Integer} The column whose width is to be set
@param.description: The column whose width is to be set

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
width {Integer|String}
The width of the specified column.  The width may be specified as
integer number of pixels (e.g. 100), a string representing percentage
of the inner width of the Table (e.g. "25%"), or a string
representing a flex width (e.g. "1*").
@param.description:
The width of the specified column.  The width may be specified as
integer number of pixels (e.g. 100), a string representing percentage
of the inner width of the Table (e.g. "25%"), or a string
representing a flex width (e.g. "1*").

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error}
Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.
@throws.description: Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the minimum width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
column {Integer}
The column whose minimum width is to be set
@param.description: The column whose minimum width is to be set

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
width {Integer}
The minimum width of the specified column.
@param.description: The minimum width of the specified column.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error}
Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.
@throws.description: Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the maximum width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
column {Integer}
The column whose maximum width is to be set
@param.description: The column whose maximum width is to be set

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
width {Integer}
The maximum width of the specified column.
@param.description: The maximum width of the specified column.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error}
Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.
@throws.description: Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
